description: ERECTION OF A SINGLE STOREY OUTBUILDING IN REAR GARDEN.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Site Location Plan; Site Plan; 01; 02

Condition : 3 - Materials as Specified - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form and Technical Specification document unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - Incidental Use - The development hereby permitted shall not be occupied at any time other than for purposes incidental to the residential use of the dwelling known as 23 Brookfields Avenue, Mitcham, CR4 4BP

Condition : 5 - CONDITION:
The development hereby approved shall implement the flood mitigation measures as submitted with the proposal titled: EA FRA Matrix. These measures shall thereafter be retained in perpetuity 
REASON:
To reduce the risk of flooding and to comply with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy SI 13 of the London Plan 2021, policy CS16 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011 and policy DM F2 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 6 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The applicant/agent was provided with pre-application advice.
   ii) The application was acceptable as submitted and no further assistance was required.
   iii) The application was approved without delay.
   iv) The application was considered by the Planning Committee where the applicant/agent had the opportunity to speak to the committee and promote the application.
